meta.title: NTS Past Paper MCQs
meta.keywords: cpwb, child attendant, past paper, mcqs, quiz

questions.q: The word Pakistan first coined by?
questions.ex: The word 'Pakistan' was coined by Chaudhry Rehmat Ali in 1933.

questions.q: Which is the currency of Saudi Arabia?
questions.ex: The currency of Saudi Arabia is the Saudi Riyal.

questions.q: How can the practitioner best help a child aged 3 years to settle into the home-based setting?
options: Leave the child alone to explore
Encourage immediate interaction with other children
Allow the child to bring a comfort item from home and stay close initially
questions.ex: Allowing the child to have a comfort item and providing close support initially helps them feel secure and settle.

questions.q: Children who suffer from a disease which prevents them from eating gluten should avoid foods containing
questions.ex: Gluten is a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye. Children with gluten intolerance or celiac disease must avoid these grains.

questions.q: When setting boundaries for children aged 5 years, adults should:
options: Be inconsistent to allow for flexibility
Provide clear and simple rules with consistent enforcement
Set boundaries but rarely enforce them
Expect children to set their own boundaries
questions.ex: Clear, simple, and consistently enforced boundaries help 5-year-olds understand expectations and feel secure.

questions.q: A child has vomited heavily after a hard bump on the head. Which of the following is the immediate action to take?
questions.ex: Heavy vomiting after a head bump can indicate a concussion or more serious injury, requiring immediate medical attention.

questions.q: What activity can help children to learn about shape and space?
options: Playing with building blocks or puzzles
questions.ex: Activities like playing with building blocks and puzzles help children understand spatial relationships and different shapes.

questions.q: Which part of a child’s body is most likely to develop a verruca?
questions.ex: Verrucas (plantar warts) commonly develop on the soles of the feet.

questions.q: A child in an early years setting slips and grazes an arm. What is the main reason for informing the child’s parents of this incident?
options: To assign blame for the incident
To keep them informed about their child's well-being and any injuries
To request payment for first aid supplies
To ask them to discipline the child
questions.ex: It is essential to keep parents informed about any incidents or injuries involving their child for transparency and their awareness of the child's well-being.

questions.q: ___ method of meeting special education needs in the ordinary school which is often contrasted with approaches based on ideas of deficit or defect, as in the medical model.
questions.ex: Inclusion is an approach that emphasizes supporting children with special educational needs within mainstream schools, contrasting with deficit-based models.

questions.q: Who is the Head of the State of Pakistan?
questions.ex: The Head of the State of Pakistan is the President.

questions.q: When first constitution of Pakistan was enforced?
questions.ex: The first constitution of Pakistan was enforced on 23rd March 1956.

questions.q: f(x)=x ^2 −2x ^3 What is the value of f(3)?
Which activity is typically not expected from a toddler (around 2 years old)?
questions.ex: While toddlers can stack blocks, building complex structures is typically a skill that develops later.

questions.q: A child who can read and write well is usually around what age?
questions.ex: Children typically develop fluent reading and writing skills around 7-8 years old, although this can vary.

questions.q: A 2-year-old child usually begins to?
questions.ex: Two-year-olds are typically beginning to combine words into short phrases.

questions.q: If a child is prohibited from eating gluten, which of the following foods should be avoided?
questions.ex: While oats are naturally gluten-free, they are often cross-contaminated during processing, so certified gluten-free oats should be used.

questions.q: A 2-year-old child who frequently leans or slides to one side might have difficulty with?
questions.ex: Leaning or sliding to one side can indicate difficulties with balance and coordination at this age.

questions.q: Stuttering is a difficulty in?
questions.ex: Stuttering is a speech disorder characterized by disruptions in the fluency of speech.

questions.q: Greenland is an autonomous territory owned by which country?
questions.ex: Greenland is an autonomous territory within the Kingdom of Denmark.

questions.q: Which part of the cell is not present in both animals and plants?
questions.ex: Animal cells do not have a cell wall; this is a characteristic of plant cells.

questions.q: The shortest Surah of the Holy Quran is _____?
questions.ex: Surah Al-Kawthar is the shortest Surah of the Holy Quran.

questions.q: Who was the first president of All India Muslim League?
questions.ex: Sir Agha Khan III was the first president of the All India Muslim League.

questions.q: Animal cells do not make their own food because they do not have _____?
questions.ex: Animal cells lack chloroplasts, which are necessary for photosynthesis (making food).

questions.q: Suez canal is located in ____?
questions.ex: The Suez Canal is located in Egypt.

questions.q: Which is the most widely spoken language in Pakistan?
questions.ex: Punjabi is the most widely spoken language in Pakistan, though Urdu is the official language.

questions.q: The largest Island of the world is _____?
questions.ex: Greenland is the world's largest island.

questions.q: Space rockets use fuel which is liquid oxygen mixed with liquid?
questions.ex: Space rockets often use liquid hydrogen as fuel with liquid oxygen as an oxidizer.

questions.q: Objects that gives out light of their own are said to be?
questions.ex: Objects that emit their own light are called luminous objects.

questions.q: Which of the following is considered the Deepest lake of the world?
questions.ex: Lake Baikal in Russia is the deepest lake in the world.

questions.q: To whom Lord Mountbatten succeeded as Governor General of India?
questions.ex: Lord Mountbatten succeeded Lord Wavell as the last Viceroy and first Governor-General of independent India.

questions.q: Who became the Governor General Of Pakistan after the death of Quiad-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah?
questions.ex: Khawaja Nazimuddin became the Governor-General of Pakistan after the death of Muhammad Ali Jinnah.

questions.q: The luminous body emits _____?
questions.ex: A luminous body emits light.

questions.q: Qadianis were declared as Non-Muslims during the government of _____?
questions.ex: Qadianis were declared as non-Muslims during the government of Zulfiqar Ali Bhutto.

questions.q: The major segment of “Saraiki” speaking population lives in _____?
questions.ex: The major segment of the Saraiki speaking population lives in South Punjab.

questions.q: Jahangir khan is a famous player in which game?
questions.ex: Jahangir Khan is a legendary professional squash player.

questions.q: Who was the last governor of undivided Punjab?
questions.ex: Sir Evan Jenkins was the last British Governor of the undivided Punjab.

questions.q: Sound cannot travel through ______?
questions.ex: Sound waves require a medium to travel and cannot propagate through a vacuum.

questions.q: Mahathir Mohamad was the Prime Minister of which country?
questions.ex: Mahathir Mohamad served as the Prime Minister of Malaysia.

questions.q: Muhammad Ali was famous for?
questions.ex: Muhammad Ali was a world-renowned professional boxer.

questions.q: Which of the following prayers does not include Azan?
questions.ex: The Janazah (funeral) prayer does not have an Azan.

questions.q: By selling a watch for Rs.144, a man losses 10%. At what price should he sell it in order to gain 15%?
questions.ex: Selling price = 144. Loss = 10%. Cost price = 144 / (1 - 0.10) = 144 / 0.9 = 160. To gain 15%, new selling price = 160 * (1 + 0.15) = 160 * 1.15 = 184.

questions.q: What is the angle between two hands of the clock at 11'0 clock?
questions.ex: At 11 o'clock, the hour hand is on 11 and the minute hand is on 12. The angle between each number on a clock is 30 degrees (360/12). The angle between 11 and 12 is 30 degrees.

questions.q: 25 is 125% of what number?
questions.ex: Let the number be x. 125% of x = 25. 1.25 * x = 25. x = 25 / 1.25 = 20.

questions.q: If it takes a machine 1/3 of a minute to produce one item, how many items will it produce in 10 minutes?
questions.ex: If it takes 1/3 minute for 1 item, then in 1 minute it produces 3 items. In 10 minutes, it will produce 10 * 3 = 30 items.

questions.q: Complete the sequence: CAX, FDY, IGZ, _____.
questions.ex: The first letter increases by 3 (C->F->I->L), the second letter increases by 3 (A->D->G->J), and the third letter moves to the next letter in the alphabet (X->Y->Z->A). So the next term is LJA.

questions.q: Kalima Tauheed is at ________ number.
questions.ex: Kalima Tayyibah (Kalima Tauheed) is the first Kalima in Islam.

questions.q: How many seats were won by the Pakistan Peoples Party in the 1970 election?
questions.ex: The Pakistan Peoples Party won 83 seats in the 1970 general election in West Pakistan.

questions.q: Which is the largest lake in Pakistan?
questions.ex: Manchar Lake is the largest natural freshwater lake in Pakistan.

questions.q: The fundamental pillar of Islam that requires both Physical and financial sacrifice is known as:
questions.ex: Hajj requires both physical travel and financial expenditure, making it the pillar that involves both types of sacrifice.

questions.q: Who make the final decision in our family system ?
questions.ex: In many traditional family systems, the father is considered the head of the household and makes the final decisions. However, modern family dynamics can vary.

questions.q: Antonym: Destroy
questions.ex: The antonym of destroy (to ruin or pull down) is create (to bring something into existence).

questions.q: Which of the following is a tissue?
questions.ex: Blood is considered a connective tissue.

questions.q: The mausoleum of Sheikh Baha-ud-Din Zakaraiya is located in the city of?
questions.ex: The mausoleum of Sheikh Baha-ud-Din Zakariya is located in Multan.

questions.q: Who built tomb of Shah Abdul Latif?
questions.ex: The tomb of Shah Abdul Latif Bhittai was built by Ghulam Shah Kalhoro.

questions.q: Karakorum Highway is built with the help of ----
questions.ex: The Karakoram Highway was built with the assistance of China.

questions.q: Which is the city of Shrines and Tombs?
questions.ex: Multan is often referred to as the 'City of Shrines and Tombs' due to the large number of Sufi shrines located there.

questions.q: Karakoram Range is located in which part of Himalaya range?
questions.ex: The Karakoram Range is located in the western part of the greater Himalayan range.

questions.q: The Karakoram Highway was constructed with the help of?
questions.ex: The Karakoram Highway was a joint venture between Pakistan and China.

questions.q: Siddique and --- the title given to Abu bakkar Siddique?
questions.ex: Abu Bakr was given the title 'Al-Atiq' (the saved one) and 'Siddiq' (the truthful).

questions.q: What is the name of the Fourth Kalima?
questions.ex: The Fourth Kalima is called Kalima Tamjeed.

questions.q: What is the Capital of United Arab Emirates?
questions.ex: The capital of the United Arab Emirates is Abu Dhabi.

questions.q: Bhutto declared Labour Policy in which year?
questions.ex: Zulfiqar Ali Bhutto announced a new Labour Policy in 1972.

questions.q: Antonym of ACCEPT
questions.ex: The antonym of accept (to receive willingly) is refuse (to decline to accept).

questions.q: To introduce students to the rhythmic use of locomotive skill; it would be more appropriate to design pattern that include hopping rather than skipping because?
options: Hopping is a more complex skill
Skipping is a more natural movement
Hopping involves a single leg action which can be more easily sequenced rhythmically initially
questions.ex: Hopping, involving a single leg, can be easier for young children to coordinate rhythmically before progressing to the more complex alternating leg action of skipping.
